alert.note: Alert for Dawson; Forsyth (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 11:34AM EST until January 10 at 4:22AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Etowah River at GA 9 near Dawsonville affecting Forsyth and Dawson Counties. For the Etowah River Basin...including Dawsonville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Etowah River at GA 9 near Dawsonville. * WHEN...From this morning to late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Moderate flooding begins in northwest Forsyth county. Old Federal Road begins to flood and Nicholson Road is closed off to residents. Minor flooding continues in south Dawson county. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 12.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.5 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.7 feet on 02/06/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1145 PM EST.
